intro: Erigeron solidaginoides, commonly known as stiffleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has linear, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Erigeron solidaginoides is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
